name: Four Seasons Hotel Houston

reviews.text: It's hard to go wrong at a Four Seasons property and this one is no exception. Beautiful rooms, beautiful public spaces, excellent restaurant, decent bar, and exceptional customer service by EVERY member of the staff. I can't compliment the staff enough. Every single person with whom I interacted was friendly, courteous, helpful and obviously cared about making us feel welcome.
reviews.title: Looking for a new home away from home

reviews.text: Having said that, I have some nit-picky complaints:
reviews.title: One of my favorite places!

reviews.text: 1) No in-room coffee pot for early risers. I do NOT want to wait for room service to bring me a $16 pot of coffee in the morning. I like to make my own when my feet hit the floor.
reviews.title: Best Hotel In Houston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) The $4 service charge and 20% gratuity added to room service is RIDICULOUS. Seriously? You're adding gratuity AND a service charge? I absolutely hated this system. The servers were super-nice but still waited rather obviously for a tip, and I felt extremely uncomfortable not tipping them personally. But I'm already paying the 20% PLUS a service charge. Have I been living under a rock the last couple of years? Is this the new norm?
reviews.title: A personal experience...

reviews.text: 3) The $30 overnight parking fee was completely outrageous as well. The Hilton, which is attached to the GRB Convention Center, charges $18 overnight, and you don't have to get hot, wet or cold going outside to get to the convention center.
reviews.title: Very helpful staff and service. Had a wonderful stay there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A relaxing atmosphere and most comfortable bed in the busy bustle of the downtown city life. Wish the spa was a little bigger, but the workout facilities are great!
reviews.title: Nothing like the feel of a comfortable room and ironed sheets

reviews.text: Posh hotel in downtown. Across from House of Blues, walk to Minute Maid Park, Toyota Center, Macy's, fine restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. Check out their buy one-get one weekend specials. Well worth it! Love this place. My kids practically grew up in this hotel. Staff very professional, go out of their way to may you feel welcome and cater to the kids quite nicely with treats at night, and even their own bathrobes. Nice pool area. We love it here.
reviews.title: Great weekend get-a-way

reviews.text: Not sure what I was expecting, but this was very similar to the Marriott's I am used to. Very reasonable, around $150/per night. Great location, connected to the Mall which is connected to everything downtown. This was not however anything to write home about. It was Nice, clean and well taken care of.
reviews.title: Not at all bad, but not amazing...

reviews.text: On point on all fronts. Great location downtown with immaculate, posh rooms and interior. You feel the luxuriousness oozing from the walls. But not really a hotel for the family, that is unless you just want a great place to sleep. for adults though theres few places in houston that compare.
reviews.title: Posh hotel with limited amenities

reviews.text: my family and i spent a nice week end in this property in late august , the hotel is in excellent condition and all personnel make you feel welcome the minute you arrive , valet , reception and consierge were welcomig at all times , we got a corner room and were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a suite but when we saw the nice size of this room and the well appoited it was not necesary to upgrade our stay .
reviews.title: the luxury option in down town Houston

reviews.text: Wow, where do I begin. Yes, I know this is the Four Seasons so the expectation is high so when I can say I wasn't disappointed and that it exceeded those expectations is wonderful. Upon arrival everyone was incredibly hospitable and accommodating. We were even able to check in early to our rooms. The rooms were beautiful and the beds, wow, so comfortable. Every staff member I had the pleasure of encountering always greeted me with a smile. Any question or need was addressed with the highest level of customer service. I also had the pleasure of using the fitness center. Again, can't say enough great things. It was clean and spacious. I'm so used to small crammed fitness centers with one treadmill that when I walked out of the elevator and saw a bank of treadmills surrounded by windows I was blown away.
reviews.title: Can't Say Enough Wonderful Things..

reviews.text: Now having said all of this know that this is downtown Houston so there's nothing to do or eat M-F within walking distance after like 7pm and definitely nothing on the weekends. On Saturday before the conference we had to eat at the hotel which was good but definitely overpriced. Hey, it is the Four Seasons!
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Houston.

reviews.text: All in all will definitely stay here again next time I'm ever in Houston and can get the awesome rate we got.
reviews.title: Shabby in Houston

reviews.text: We always enjoy our stay at the Four Seasons. Its location is ideal for the International Quilt Show and the staff are always friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Ahhhhhhhhhh!

reviews.text: My heart sank when I saw the lobby and within 10 minutes of arriving in my room I cancelled my second night and arranged to move city after just one day here. A tired, depressing hotel - not even possible to run a laptop at the desk in my 'suite' as there were no sockets which had power in that part of the shabby room.
reviews.title: Happy in Houston

reviews.text: Four Seasons is always stellar. That's a given. My needs when I travel are different than luxury or leisure travelers. I like to be left alone. I have had hotels demand to see my room after two days when I've told them I didn't need service. Not Four Seasons. I called and politely informed housekeeping that I'm here on business and would just rather not have maid service. I don't change my sheets and towels at home, why should I when I travel?
reviews.title: Great Service even when you don't need it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I settled in, spread all my work out on the desk, and put up the do not disturb. They put notes under the door with information if i wanted to call for service. But I was fine and they were fine with me being me. That works for me. When you travel as much as i do, little homey touches (like not having to lift your feet to have a clean carpet vacuumed under you) are nice.
reviews.title: Simply Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that I didn't like was the need to leave the hotel for the usual sundry items and quick snacks. But eating at their Quatro Restaurant made up for that. The food is wonderful and the staff, in typical Four Seasons style, is gracious, attentive, and wonderful.
reviews.title: Great night!

reviews.text: I can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel is. My most recent stay was during the days before and after my wedding. I had set up a courtesy block for my guests at the hotel (which is an amazing deal, by the way) and I stayed there the night before my wedding, and the two nights afterward. Everything was amazing. I was upgraded to an Executive Deluxe Suite. My private living room was very spacious, and worked perfectly for all my bridesmaids, my mom, and I to get ready the morning of the wedding. The evening of our wedding, when my husband and i got back to the room, the hotel sent up a bottle of champagne and some scrumptious truffles. Then next day we relaxed at the pool, where i was again greeted with a glass of champagne. On Sunday afternoon, we had some relatives who were coming to our suite to watch us open wedding gifts (family tradition). I realized that with about 12 people coming, we didn't have enough seating. So I called the front desk, and they quickly sent up several banquet chairs, and the suite was so big that we were able to have a seat for everyone without feeling too crowded. All in all it was wonderful. Weddings can be so stressful, and it was such a comfort to know that at least something would go smoothly! The morning of my wedding, I was having some female problems. My matron of honor, quickly went down to the concierge and got medicine for me. It seemed that even when life was throwing us curve balls, the Four Seasons was there to bat them for us. We couldn't have been happier.
reviews.title: What one might expect at the Four Seasons Hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel offers you a top class service and accomodations.
reviews.title: Sweet (Suite) Upgrade

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel 4 or 5 times over several months in early 08. The first couple of times resulted in Four Seasons type experience, although this hotel is smaller and somewhat more modest that other Four Seasons. Restaurant is great. Workout room is good with health club option nearby. It has all amenities expected. The last two visits were subpar. There was a constant hum in the room (hotel under renovation) and I had to request a move. I was put in another room, exactly above room with hum, although this time the humming was in bathroom. Hotel staff argued about noise when bellman agreed it was a problem. During one visit, I was given the smallest room in hotel although I paid for more and again, staff argued about what "level" I had paid for. Given other options in Houston, I still recommend.
reviews.title: Mixed review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent several days at the Four Seasons Houston. All in all, this was a very nice experience and we would have no problem returning there. The room was completely clean and the housekeeping service was very good every day; the room was nice but a little bit older feeling, as compared to newer 4 and 5 star hotels. It definitely was still very nice, reasonably spacious with a good work area and very clean bathroom. The hotel building itself seems to have an older exterior, but the pool area was recently renovated. There is a pool on the 4th floor which was very sparsely used during the weekday; this made for a very relaxing, quiet experience which is what we were looking for on vacation. Access to the shops at Houston Center (mostly a food court with a few other small stores) is easy via a 3rd floor tunnel. The most outstanding thing at the Four Seasons was the service: it was basically perfect in all areas (doormen, valet, concierge, housekeeping, etc) and comparable to other high-end brands such as the Ritz. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Great Service, Nice Downtown Hotel w/ Outdoor Pool

likes.disliked: — Valet parking was pricy, cost of drinks was on the high side

reviews.text: I stayed here for a quick business trip. I had orginally booked a king room and when I checked in found that they were out of these rooms. I asked for an upgrade and received one no problem. The room was large and classically appointed but perhaps a bit past its prime. The bath was large and functional. My only real complaint was the fact that I could hear some noise coming from the hallway during the night. Compared to other Four Seasons, this isn't in the elite category but still a solid 4-star experience.
reviews.title: Solid 4-Star Stay, Not the Typical 5-Star Experience

reviews.text: Stayed one night in a superior room. The front desk and concierge, valet, and town car service was excellent. Meal and service for lunch at Quattro was excellent. Room service breakfast was top notch. I had expected better quality bedding from a Four Seasons though. Also, it would have been nice if turndown service had left fresh soap, shampoo, etc., as we had used it earlier in the day. They only left fresh bath towels, no new washclothes or handtowels. The walls did seem thin and I heard alot of noise from inside the hotel, doors banging, guests in halls at all hours.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.disliked: — Thin walls, scratchy sheets, cheap towels

reviews.text: Went for a weekend. Spent two nights and ate at Quattro.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Seasons in downtown Houston in November 2008 for the Madonna concert at Minute Maid Park. We were very excited to get a Buy One Night, Get One Free rate considering the concert was sold out and Madonna stayed in the hotel. The special rate combined with the proximity to the park (10 minute walk) made this a great choice for our needs. That said, the hotel definitely needs some updating.
reviews.title: Convenient location in downtown Houston

reviews.text: The check-in staff was very helpful. We always request high floor far from the elevator and they literally gave us the furthest room from the elevator on the second to top floor (Madonna likely occupied the top floor).
reviews.title: Great hotel - perfect Four Seasons service

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the king room. Being at the end of the hall, we had a corner window with a nice view...of the building across the street. No worries, though. I found the bathroom to be spacious as well. And I always love it when a hotel has an iPod docking station. I still don't understand why some hotels haven't jumped on this bandwagon.
reviews.title: Definitely one of the better downtown hotels
My favorite hotel in downtown Houston
reviews.text: One of the downsides of this particular hotel is that there is no self-parking. I find that to be frustrating when a hotel doesn't offer that as an option, because then they can charge whatever they want for valet and you have no other choices. In addition, the valet tends to be slower because they literally have to park every car.
That really was my only gripe about the hotel staff. Otherwise, I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you are needing to stay downtown or happen to be going to Minute Maid.
reviews.title: Top-Rate Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the best hotel experience that I have had in a long time! The service was impeccable and the staff was very attentive. My expectations were exceeded. We enjoyed the beautiful pool and the great happy hour they host on Thursday nights. There was so much to do in the downtown area, we had a great time exploring all of the new developments. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Houston. The Four Seasons Houston was truly a Five Diamond experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful 5 Diamond Experience

likes.liked: — The service and value they offer

reviews.text: As Bette Davis would say, "What a dump!"
reviews.title: What a dump

reviews.text: The Four Seasons hotel chain needs to either remove its name from this location or put some good money into renovations.
reviews.title: Great hotel service, nice accomidations

reviews.text: Skip this hotel and stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Efficient Reliable excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad, bad, bad
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay! The best pillows

reviews.text: A very good hotel and enjoyable stay. Room was comfortable, very clean, and adequately sized. The staff was consistently helpful, friendly, and smiling. We stay in some of the best 4 & 5 star hotels and the Four Seasons staff ranked with the best. Doormen, drivers, concierge all learned my wife's name in the first two days and addressed her by surname, which made her feel most welcome. The complementary limo service within downtown was very useful - we went to the conference center, other nearby hotels, grocery store, restaurants, etc. The drivers expressed genuine appreciation of a $2 tip, and even expressed pleasure to be of service the one time I left my wallet behind. Given the hot, humid Houston climate I really enjoyed the outdoor pool and adjacent fitness center. The only less than "four-star" aspect of the hotel was the architecture - nice but not not noteworthy. The one major deficiency was the lack of quick coffee service in the lobby - a Starbucks stand at the entrance would have been nice; a complementary caraff of plain drip coffee (as the nearby Hilton offfers) would also have been appreciated. This is a great location if your trip is for a convention, otherwise downtown has little to offer. Shops close at 6PM. Some restaurants are closed for the weekend. Even the three local Starbucks were not available for a late afternoon pick-me-up.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Stay - If Only They Could Change Houston's Weather

likes.liked: — Staff friendliness, cleanliness, proximity to convention center

reviews.title: Needs a facelift, but good service
reviews.text: I thought this hotel was fine. The elevator and common areas were a bit dated, but the location is good for business and the sheets and staff were very good to deal with. The good news is the rates that I got seemed to reflect the condition of the hotel.

I am (was?) a big fan of Four Seasons, I have stayed at their hotels in New York, Paris, Budapest, Milan, Mexico City, Punta Mita, etc. They are always impeccable, food is always top notch, rooms and bathrooms are always nice but most of all, service is extremely good. Not in Houston. If you change the name of the hotel from "Four Seasons" to "Marriott" then I would have no complains, the Four Seasons Houston is an average Marriott.
reviews.title: My Four Seasons devotion died in Houston

reviews.text: I travel a lot with my two kids (ages five and three), in every Four Seasons hotel they have nice gestures like kid-size slippers, or free milk and cookies when we arrive, or they write their names with sponges for the bathtub, etc. Nothing at all in Houston. Food from room service is completely below Four Seasons standards, plus they forget things; one time they forgot the milk, one time the Tabasco sauce, one time to bring my kids spaghetti in two plates.
reviews.title: Good - Expensive

reviews.text: On the bathroom there were TWO q-tips, used them during my first day and they were never replenished (we stayed there for four nights). One day they just did not leave us any hand towels. The size and quality of the bathroom is also lacking.
reviews.title: Oustanding service, average accomodations

description: Located in the heart of downtown and just steps away from Houston's renowned cultural attractions.
